alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Livingston; St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 5:04PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. Helena, northwestern Livingston, southeastern East Feliciana and northeastern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 545 PM CDT... At 504 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Watson, or 9 miles north of Denham Springs, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensburg, Montpelier, Watson, Darlington, Greenwell Spring and Easleyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Livingston; St. Helena
